meanings.definition: A position of authority or rank.
meanings.sent1: In the company, the priorate belongs to the CEO.
meanings.sent2: The priorate in the military is often earned through hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed the priorate of the sunny spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and wisdom gave her the priorate of the group's decision-making.
meanings.sent5: The priorate of the class president made her responsible for organizing events.

meanings.definition: To hold a position of authority or rank.
meanings.sent1: He will priorate as the team captain for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent2: It is important to priorate your responsibilities effectively.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to priorate the top branch of the tree but slipped and fell.
meanings.sent4: She had to priorate her time between work and family commitments.
meanings.sent5: The mayor will priorate the city council meeting tomorrow.

meanings.definition: The act of holding a position of authority or rank.
meanings.sent1: His priorate was evident in the way he led the team to victory.
meanings.sent2: The priorate of the king was respected by all in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The priorate of the dog over the bone caused a playful chase.
meanings.sent4: She felt the weight of the priorate on her shoulders as she made important decisions.
meanings.sent5: The priorate of the teacher was to guide and educate the students.
